Lets learn D3

D3 demystified: No wizardry required (though you'll feel like a wizard)

Session 1: Web Development Basics (Completed on 10th Jan, 2026)

Before diving into D3, you'll need to understand the core web technologies it's built on. This session covers:

  1. Initial Setup - Get your development environment ready
  2. Basic HTML - Learn the structure of web pages
  3. Basic CSS - Style and layout fundamentals
  4. Basic SVG - Scalable Vector Graphics for data visualization
  5. Basic JavaScript - The programming language that powers D3
  6. D3 Example - See what's possible with D3
  7. Exercises - Practice what you've learned

Session 2: D3 Basics (Completed on 17th Jan, 2026)

  1. D3 initial setup - Add D3 to your project
  2. D3 selection - Select, modify, and bind data to HTML/DOM elements
  3. D3 data binding - Bind your data to HTML/DOM elements and create data-driven visualizations
  4. D3 scales - Transform data values into visual properties (positions, sizes, colors)

Session 3: D3 Simple Charts

  1. Vertical bar chart
  2. Horizontal bar chart
  3. Grouped bar chart
  4. Line chart

Session 4: D3 Intermediate Charts

Coming soon - Scatter plots, area charts, and more complex visualizations

Coming soon - Hierarchical data, force layouts, and advanced techniques

Coming soon - Building your own custom visualizations from scratch

Session 7: D3 and Observable Notebooks

Coming soon - Working with Observable for interactive data exploration

Session 8: Modern Web Development with D3

Coming soon - Integrating D3 with modern JavaScript workflows

Coming soon - Version control and deploying your visualizations
